title: Drawing, "Bedroom in a Country Dacha", 1839
medium: Brush and watercolor, pen and blue ink, graphite on white wove paper
inscribed: On original mount, in pen and brown ink, in Cyrillic characters: spal'naya v Kishkovskoi dachi 1839 goda
provenance: Eugene V. Thaw Collection; Hazlitt, Gooden & Fox, London
description: The location of this room is identified as the country house of the Kishkovsky family in Russia. The coved ceiling is decorated in a blue design, the walls are papered in yellow and blue stripes and the floor is carpeted in a geometric pattern. A desk, placed in front of a tall mirror between the windows, is furnished with candlesticks. A small hanging bookshelf and cabinet-on-stand, mounted with a flowered porcelain plaque, are next to the door at the rear. An elegant daybed, covered in green, and a privacy screen are placed on the long wall on the left.

exhibitions.title: House Proud: 19th Century Watercolor Interiors from the Thaw Collection
